comment.body:
> Thanks for checking, could you please send the full address of the resource to which stealth should not be applied? These domains unlock too much, on my mind Maybe something like:
> 
> ```
> @@||cdn.idevbase.com/static/$stealth,domain=ohttps.com
> @@||ohttps.com^$stealth
> ```

cool，problem solved。Thanks

comment.body:
>Cannot find an “annoyance” filter

To enable `AdGuard Annoyances filter`, please open AdGuard app, tap on the second icon from the left on the bottom. Then tap on `Safari protection` -> `Filters` -> `Annoyances`, enable `AdGuard Annoyances filter` and update filters (like on the screenshots below).

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![1](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/a07356c2-84ff-4884-90d8-880dfbf0abf3)
![2](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/8f20e832-7e94-4447-be97-e04dace5160c)

@AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers Could you please take a look?

comment.body:
I can reproduce some problems on this website, but only in Firefox.
For example, I cannot add item to cart, even if I disable all filter lists and add just this exception:
```adblock
@@||store-jp.nintendo.com^$cookie
```
It looks like that rules with `$cookie` don't work well on this website in Firefox, maybe related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2265

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

comment.body:
Sadly iOS does not support regex rules :(

These two rules should work though without breaking something unless they decide to store other js files in exactly that path.

```
/wp-content/*.js$script,domain=tecsafe.de|noobguides.de|wagenheber24.de|indibit.de|der-windows-papst.de|technikshavo.de|emojiszumkopieren.de|vampster.com
@@/wp-content/*/*$script,domain=tecsafe.de|noobguides.de|wagenheber24.de|indibit.de|der-windows-papst.de|technikshavo.de|emojiszumkopieren.de|vampster.com
```
